LC50; Species: Atlantic silverside (Menidia menidia), average length = 18.1 (14-26) mm, average weight = 0.048 (0.013-0.094) g; Concentration: > 0.188 mg a.i./L (Fluroxypyr MHE (99.1% a.i.) with solvent (64 uL DMF/L); Conditions: flow-through /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/

LC50; Species: Daphnia magna (water flea), neonates (< 24 hours old); Concentration: > 0.11 mg a.i./L (Technical grade fluroxypyr MHE (98.5% a.i.)); Conditions: static renewal. /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/

LC50; Species: Daphnia magna (water flea), juveniles; Concentration: > 0.6 mg a.i./L (Technical grade fluroxypyr MHE (a.i. not reported) in acetone vehicle) for 48 hr; Conditions: static /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/

LC50; Species: Eastern Oyster (Crassostrea virginica), juvenile, valve height = 25-33 mm, control shell deposition = 3.0 mm; Concentration: 51 mg a.i./L (Fluroxypyr acid (98.7% a.i.)) for 96 hr (95% confidence index 42-62 ppm); Conditions: flow-through shell deposition.

LC50; Species: Easter oyster (Crassostrea virginica), juvenile, mean valve height = 26-40 mm, peripheral shell growth prior to testing = 3-5 mm; Concentration: 0.068 mg a.i./L (Fluroxypyr MHE (95.8% a.i.) with DMF solvent) for 96 hr; Conditions: flow-through shell deposition. /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/
LC50; Species: Grass shrimp (Palaemonetes pugio), juvenile; Concentration: > 120 mg a.i./L (Fluroxypyr acid (98.7% a.i.)) for 96 hr; Conditions: flow-through.

LC50; Species: Grass Shrimp (Palaemonetes pugio), juvenile; Concentration: > 0.135 mg a.i./L (measured) or > 0.100 ppm (nominal) (Fluroxypyr MHE (95.8% a.i.) with dimethylformamide solvent) for 96 hr; Conditions: flow-through. /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/

LC50; Species: Pink Shrimp (Penaeus duorarum), average rostrum-telson length = 46 (38-54) mm, average wet weight = 0.69 (0.37-1.08) g; Concentration: > 0.128 mg a.i./L (Fluroxypyr MHE (99.1% a.i.)) for 96 hr; Conditions: flow-through. /Fluroxypyr-1-methylheptyl ester/
